alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 20 at 3:55PM EDT until May 20 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR MONROE AND NORTHERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 354 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mount Pocono to near Stormville to near Kunkletown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belfast, East Bangor, Stormville, Henryville, Brodheadsville, Kunkletown, Delaware Water Gap, Skytop, Tannersville, Mountainhome, Alpine Mountain, Rossland, Reeders and Saylorsburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 296 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey near mile marker 3. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 10. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
